name: Kel-P
description:
'''Udoma Peter Kelvin Amba''' popularly known by his trademark '''It's Kel-P Vibes''' is a Nigerian [[record producer]], singer and songwriter. He is the founder and the CEO of Bully Entertainment, and is currently signed to Universal Music Publishing France, Universal Music France, and Virgin Music France, with a management deal with [[Jones Worldwide]]. He was formerly signed to [[Aristokrat Records|Aristokrat]] from 2019 to 2023, and is best known for exclusively producing and co-writing the [[62nd Annual Grammy Awards|Grammy]] nominated [[Grammy Award for Best World Music Album|world album]] ''[[African Giant]]'' in 2019.

He was credited by [[OkayAfrica]], as one of the key figures who have helped take [[Afrobeats]] to new heights. In 2021, he co-produced the [[64th Grammy Awards|Grammy]] winning [[Grammy Award for Best Global Music Album|Best Global Album]] ''Mother Nature'' by [[Angélique Kidjo]], and Grammy nominated album [[Made in Lagos]] (Deluxe version) by [[Wizkid]]. In 2023, he co-produced the Grammy-nominated [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year|album]] ''[[The Age of Pleasure]]'' by [[Janelle Monáe]], and co-wrote the Grammy-nominated [[Grammy Award for Best Global Music Album|Best Global Album]] ''[[Timeless (Davido album)|Timeless]]'' by [[Davido]], which earned him, a special recognition from [[The Recording Academy]].
